author: Paige MacPherson
description: Commentary Odds are, you can’t tell whether this sentence was written by artificial intelligence. Schools across Canada face the same problem. And happily, some are finding simple solutions. Manitoba’s Franco-Manitoban School Division (Division scolaire franco-manitobaine) recently issued new AI guidelines for teachers: to only assign optional homework and reading in grades kindergarten to 6, and […]
title: Schools Should Go Back to Basics to Mitigate Effects of AI

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Government House Leader Steven MacKinnon says he is aware of other Conservative MPs who may consider crossing the floor as they share the views of Michael Ma, who defected to the Liberals on Dec. 11. MacKinnon told reporters on Dec. 12 there’s a minority of Tory MPs who are “frustrated” with the party leadership, while […]
title: Liberal House Leader MacKinnon Says He Thinks ‘There Are Others’ Considering Defecting From Tories

author: Michael Wing
description: Next month, just days after most major cities across the globe will have rung in the new year with fireworks, another fireworks show will appear 60 miles high in Earth’s atmosphere. On Jan. 3, one of the year’s four major meteor showers, the Quadrantids, will collide with Earth as it makes its annual pass through […]
title: One of the Best Meteor Showers of the Year Will Kick Off 2026—What to Know

author: Janice Hisle
description: New rules will be enacted to better track money flowing 'to areas of concern, such as Somalia,' the Treasury secretary said.
title: Treasury, IRS Crack Down on Somali Fund Transfers While Probing ‘Massive Fraud Ring’

author: Andrew Moran
description: The largest tanker ever seized was linked to narcotics and crude oil, the administration said.
title: Sanctioned Oil Tanker Seized by US Near Venezuela: What to Know

author: The Canadian Press
description: Economists are expecting Statistics Canada’s consumer price index report for November, slated to be released on Monday, to show the annual inflation rate moved slightly higher from the prior month. A Reuters poll on Friday showed the consensus among economists is that headline inflation for November will come in at 2.3 percent, according to LSEG […]
title: Economists Expect Annual Inflation Ticked up to 2.3 Percent in November

author: Noé Chartier
description: The Liberal government’s second attempt at passing a bill aiming to strengthen the border and immigration rules was successful before the House of Commons went on Christmas break. The last few days of proceedings were eventful on Parliament Hill, with another Tory MP defecting to the Liberals and the Bloc Québécois managing to amend the […]
title: Liberal Border Bill Clears House—and Other Last-Minute Moves on Parliament Hill Before Christmas Break

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Canadian patients faced an average wait of 28.6 weeks from family doctor referral to treatment this year, the second-longest wait in more than three decades, according to a new study. The study, released on Dec. 9 by the Fraser Institute, collected data from physicians nationwide across 12 medical specialties, including several types of surgeries. It […]
title: Canada’s Health-Care Wait Times Reach 28.6 Weeks, Among the Highest in 30 Years: Report

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Ottawa will give out a record high in equalization payments to the provinces next year totalling more than $27 billion, an increase of roughly $1 billion from this year. The federal equalization program involves the transfer of tax dollars collected by Ottawa from across the country to provinces with lesser abilities to raise revenues at […]
title: 2026 Equalization Payments Reach Record $27 Billion

author: Carolina Avendano
description: A new report warns that prominent Western universities, including Canadian institutions, have collaborated with Chinese artificial-intelligence labs on research that could advance Beijing’s mass-surveillance apparatus and other tools tied to human rights abuses. The Dec. 8 report, authored by the New York-based business intelligence firm Strategy Risks in partnership with the non-profit Human Rights Foundation, […]
title: Report Raises Concerns About Canadian Universities, Others Collaborating With Beijing-Backed AI Labs

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Surrey Mayor Brenda Locke says that suspects in a rash of extortion cases are abusing Canada’s immigration system in claiming refugee status to avoid deportation. “I am appalled to learn that suspects identified by B.C.’s Extortion Task Force are claiming refugee status to evade deportation,” Locke posted on X on Dec. 11. “Law-abiding Canadians and […]
title: Surrey BC Mayor ‘Appalled’ as Extortion Suspects Seek Asylum to Avoid Deportation

author: Olivia Gomm
description: MPs are reviewing the government's billions in subsidies to the vehicle manufacturing company.
title: Industry Official Tells MPs He Regrets Giving Them ‘Mistaken Impression’ About Redacted Stellantis Contract

author: The Canadian Press
description: WestJet has paused a move to install non-reclining seats on a big slice of its fleet after pushback from employees and passengers. The airline announced in September it would reconfigure the seating on 43 Boeing 737 jets to install an extra row and divide the cabin into several tiers, some with more space—and pricier tickets—than […]
title: WestJet Pauses Move to Install Non-Reclining Seats After Blowback

author: Chandra Philip
description: Premier Scott Moe is urging a Saskatchewan woman with a rare disease not to go through with medically assisted death, but to continue working with the provincial health care system for solutions. Regina resident Jolene Van Alstine has a rare form of parathyroid disease called normocalcemic primary hyperparathyroidism, and has had three surgeries but still […]
title: Sask. Premier Urges Woman With Rare Disease Seeking Euthanasia to ‘Continue to Work’ With Health Ministry for Solutions

author: Victoria Friedman
description: ControlAI Founder Andrea Miotti said that within a year, the group had reached this milestone and 'more are joining every week.'
title: More Than 100 UK Lawmakers Back Call for Regulations on Advanced AI

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The president said the two leaders agreed to end renewed hostilities and return to a previous peace framework he helped broker.
title: Trump Says Thailand, Cambodia Agree to Cease-Fire After Calls With Leaders

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The Bank of England is currently holding its benchmark interest rate at 4 percent and will announce its next decision on Dec. 18.
title: UK Economy Contracted Ahead of Autumn Tax-Raising Budget, Official Figures Show

author: The Canadian Press
description: Floodwaters have started to recede in parts of Abbotsford, B.C., but more rain is in store for the flood-drenched Fraser Valley, where hundreds of properties have been evacuated. Overflow from the Nooksack River in Washington state that poured north into the valley had been expected to peak today, and residents are waiting to see the […]
title: Abbotsford Floodwaters Receding as BC Braces for More Rain on Way

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Thirty-four suspects are facing nearly 140 charges following an investigation into a gang suspected of trafficking firearms and drugs throughout the Greater Toronto Area, with operations reaching as far as Manitoba. Durham Regional Police held a press conference on Dec. 12 to announce the results of Project Hydrogen, an investigation into criminal activity linked to […]
title: 34 Arrested in Southern Ontario Probe of Drugs and Guns Linked to ’44’ Gang

description: The move comes as the Trump administration rolls back TPS designations it says have been exploited and fuel illegal immigration.
title: DHS Ends Temporary Protected Status for Ethiopians

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The first segment of the federal government’s proposed high-speed rail network will connect Ottawa to Montreal. The planned rail project connecting Toronto to Quebec City will span 1,000 kilometres in total and is expected to begin construction in 2029. Marking Canada’s first high-speed rail network, it would involve trains that travel up to 300 kilometres […]
title: First Leg of High-Speed Rail Project to Connect Montreal and Ottawa

description: The action plan comes a month after a huge corruption scandal at the state energy company resulted in the resignation of some of Zelenskyy's cabinet.
title: EU, Kyiv Agree Plan to Tackle Corruption in Ukraine to Ease Country’s Path to Membership

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Machado has described the Maduro government as a criminal structure funded by trafficking networks.

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Dollarama sales hit nearly $2 billion in its latest quarter amid the rising cost of living, as consumer purchases of household goods like groceries and toiletries helped increase sales by 22.2 percent. The Canadian discount retailer reported $1.9 billion for the third quarter ending on Nov. 2, in contrast to $1.5 billion for the same […]
title: Dollarama Sales Surge 22% as Shoppers Flock to Lower-Cost Household Staples

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The latest violence has erupted along more than a dozen points on the 508-mile border between the two countries.
title: Thailand’s PM to Speak With Trump as Fighting With Cambodia Rages, Snap Election Called

description: Last year, a think tank advised the United States to ban Chinese lidar from critical and defense sectors because the technology could impact national security.

description: Rachel Reeves said she and Sir Keir Starmer had decided “as a team” not to raise income tax as she hit out at “too many leaks” in the run-up to Budget. The Chancellor told MPs the “very close partnership” between herself and the Prime Minister meant the move to extend a freeze on tax thresholds […]

author: PA Media
description: A soldier killed in Ukraine as he watched the testing of a new defensive capability was a 28-year-old paratrooper. The “tragic accident” happened on Tuesday morning when Lance Corporal George Hooley was with Ukrainian military counterparts. Sir Keir Starmer paid tribute to the Parachute Regiment soldier at Prime Minister’s Questions, saying: “Lance Corporal Hooley was […]
title: British Soldier Killed in Ukraine Was 28-Year-Old Paratrooper

author: PA Media
description: A man who killed his former partner’s sister and her three children by setting fire to their house in a botched revenge attack has been found guilty of murder. Sharaz Ali was “motivated by jealousy and fuelled by drink and drugs” when he started the “catastrophic” blaze at the home of Bryonie Gawith and her […]
title: Man Who Killed Ex-partner’s Sister and Her Children in Fire Guilty of Murder

author: PA Media
description: A “heart-breaking” littering fine for an 86-year-old grandfather who says he spat out a leaf which blew into his mouth is a “total disgrace”, his daughter has said. Roy Marsh was fined by enforcement officers in February while walking around a boating lake in Skegness, Lincolnshire. His daughter Jane Fitzpatrick said her father, who has […]
title: Fine for Grandfather Who Spat out Leaf a ‘Total Disgrace’, Says Daughter

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The AFP charged him with lying about his bankruptcy status on a Senate nomination form for the 2022 federal election.
title: Great Australian Party Nomineee Rod Culleton Sentenced for Election Fraud

author: Reuters
description: TOKYO—An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.7 ‍hit Japan’s northeastern region ‍on Friday, prompting a tsunami advisory for waves ‌up to 1 metre (39 inch) ⁠high from the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA). The quake struck at 11:44 a.m. (0244 GMT) off the coast of Aomori prefecture ⁠with ‍a depth of 20 km (12 miles), […]

author: Jarvis Lim
description: Beijing’s intensifying military and economic pressure against Tokyo is seen as a strategy to mask deepening domestic instability and social unrest.

author: PA Media
description: Life expectancy for females in the UK has returned to pre-pandemic levels – though males have yet to show a similar recovery, new estimates suggest. A baby girl born between 2022 and 2024 can expect to live for an average of 83.0 years, while a baby boy born is likely to live for 79.1 years. […]

description: PEI Premier Rob Lantz announced that he is stepping down from his position leading the province in order to enter the race for permanent leadership of the Progressive Conservative Party. description: The Treasury Department targeted narco-traffickers and illicit oil distributors, adding to the list of blocked Venezuelan individuals and businesses.

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Ontario MP Michael Ma has left the Conservative caucus to join the governing Liberals, the second Tory lawmaker to do so in just over a month. Ma, the MP representing Markham—Unionville, said in a statement on Dec. 11 that he made the decision after reflecting with his family and those in his riding “on the […]
title: Another Conservative MP Crosses Floor to Join Liberal Caucus
